newsitem.title: UK: Ford unions plan UK strike ballot.
newsitem.headline: Ford unions plan UK strike ballot.

text.p: Unions at Ford's British operations plan a ballot on industrial action as soon as possible and expect to complete the process within five or six weeks, a union official said on Thursday.

Transport and General Workers Union national officer Tony Woodley said: "We will be moving to a ballot as soon as humanly possible." Ford announced last week that it planned to axe 1,300 jobs at its Halewood plant in north-west England.
Woodley said that unions would have to overcome legal obstacles before they could complete the ballot.
He said mass meetings of Ford workers this week had resulted in overwhelming support for the unions' position in opposing the company's plans.
Union officials said earlier they expected the ballot paper to contain two questions -- whether workers favoured a strike or industrial action short of a walkout.
Woodley told reporters: "This is the most serious dispute we have seen in our industry for two decades."
